meanings.definition: The state or quality of being viscous.
meanings.sent1: The viscosities of the honey made it difficult to pour.
meanings.sent2: The viscosities of the glue helped it adhere strongly to the paper.
meanings.sent3: The silly putty's viscosities seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: The traffic moved at the viscosities of molasses on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The viscosities of the mud made it feel like quicksand underfoot.

meanings.definition: The property of a fluid that resists the force tending to cause the fluid to flow.
meanings.sent1: The viscosities of the engine oil kept the parts lubricated.
meanings.sent2: The viscosities of the syrup made it flow slowly down the pancake stack.
meanings.sent3: The ketchup bottle's viscosities seemed to be playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was thick, like the viscosities of a stagnant pond.
meanings.sent5: The viscosities of the shampoo made it difficult to rinse out completely.
